CMS Advanced Electronic Signatures (CAdES)

contents.text: Status of This Memo
contents.zh-CHS: 关于下段备忘

contents.text: This memo provides information for the Internet community. It does not specify an Internet standard of any kind. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
contents.zh-CHS: 本备忘录为互联网社区提供信息。它没有规定任何类型的互联网标准。本备忘录的分发不受限制。

contents.text: Abstract
contents.zh-CHS: 摘要

contents.text: This document defines the format of an electronic signature that can remain valid over long periods. This includes evidence as to its validity even if the signer or verifying party later attempts to deny (i.e., repudiates) the validity of the signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定了可以长期有效的电子签字的格式。这包括关于签名有效性的证据，即使签名人或验证方后来试图否认（即否认）签名的有效性。

contents.text: The format can be considered as an extension to RFC 3852 and RFC 2634, where, when appropriate, additional signed and unsigned attributes have been defined.
contents.zh-CHS: 该格式可以视为RFC 3852和RFC 2634的扩展，在适当的情况下，定义了附加的有符号和无符号属性。

contents.text: The contents of this Informational RFC amount to a transposition of the ETSI Technical Specification (TS) 101 733 V.1.7.4 (CMS Advanced Electronic Signatures -- CAdES) and is technically equivalent to it.
contents.zh-CHS: 本信息RFC的内容相当于ETSI技术规范（TS）101 733 V.1.7.4（CMS高级电子签名——CAdES）的换位，在技术上与之相当。

1. Introduction
contents.zh-CHS: 1. 介绍

contents.text: This document is intended to cover electronic signatures for various types of transactions, including business transactions (e.g., purchase requisition, contract, and invoice applications) where long-term validity of such signatures is important. This includes evidence as to its validity even if the signer or verifying party later attempts to deny (i.e., repudiates; see ISO/IEC 10181-5 [ISO10181-5]) the validity of the signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件旨在涵盖各类交易的电子签名，包括商业交易（如请购单、合同和发票申请），此类签名的长期有效性非常重要。这包括关于其有效性的证据，即使签名人或验证方后来试图否认（即否认；见ISO/IEC 10181-5[ISO10181-5]）签名的有效性。

contents.text: Thus, the present document can be used for any transaction between an individual and a company, between two companies, between an individual and a governmental body, etc. The present document is independent of any environment; it can be applied to any environment, e.g., smart cards, Global System for Mobile Communication Subscriber Identity Module (GSM SIM) cards, special programs for electronic signatures, etc.
contents.zh-CHS: 因此，本文件可用于个人与公司、两家公司、个人与政府机构等之间的任何交易。本文件独立于任何环境；它可以应用于任何环境，例如智能卡、全球移动通信用户识别模块系统（GSM SIM）卡、电子签名专用程序等。

contents.text: The European Directive on a community framework for Electronic Signatures defines an electronic signature as: "Data in electronic form which is attached to or logically associated with other electronic data and which serves as a method of authentication".
contents.zh-CHS: 《欧洲共同体电子签名框架指令》将电子签名定义为：“附属于其他电子数据或与其他电子数据在逻辑上有关联的电子形式数据，作为认证方法”。

contents.text: An electronic signature, as used in the present document, is a form of advanced electronic signature, as defined in the Directive.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件中使用的电子签名是指令中定义的高级电子签名的一种形式。

contents.text: 2. Scope
contents.zh-CHS: 2. 范围

contents.text: The scope of the present document covers electronic signature formats only. The aspects of Electronic Signature Policies are defined in RFC 3125 [RFC3125] and ETSI TR 102 272 [TR102272].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件的范围仅涵盖电子签字格式。RFC 3125[RFC3125]和ETSI TR 102 272[TR102272]中定义了电子签名策略的各个方面。

contents.text: The present document defines a number of electronic signature formats, including electronic signatures that can remain valid over long periods. This includes evidence as to its validity even if the
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件界定了若干电子签字格式，包括可以长期有效的电子签字。这包括关于其有效性的证据，即使

contents.text: signer or verifying party later attempts to deny (repudiates) the validity of the electronic signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名人或验证方随后试图否认（否认）电子签名的有效性。

contents.text: The present document specifies use of Trusted Service Providers (e.g., Time-Stamping Authorities) and the data that needs to be archived (e.g., cross-certificates and revocation lists) to meet the requirements of long-term electronic signatures.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定使用受信任的服务提供者（例如，时间戳管理机构）和需要存档的数据（例如，交叉证书和撤销清单），以满足长期电子签名的要求。

contents.text: An electronic signature, as defined by the present document, can be used for arbitration in case of a dispute between the signer and verifier, which may occur at some later time, even years later.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件所界定的电子签名可用于在签名人和验证者之间发生争议时进行仲裁，这种争议可能发生在以后某个时间，甚至几年之后。

contents.text: The present document includes the concept of signature policies that can be used to establish technical consistency when validating electronic signatures, but it does not mandate their use.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件载有签字政策的概念，可用于在验证电子签字时建立技术上的一致性，但并不要求使用这些政策。

contents.text: The present document is based on the use of public key cryptography to produce digital signatures, supported by public key certificates. The present document also specifies the use of time-stamping and time-marking services to prove the validity of a signature long after the normal lifetime of critical elements of an electronic signature. This document also, as an option, defines ways to provide very long-term protection against key compromise or weakened algorithms.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件的基础是使用公钥加密技术产生数字签名，并附有公钥证书。本文件还具体规定了使用时间戳和时间标记服务，在电子签名关键要素的正常使用期限之后很久证明签名的有效性。作为一种选择，本文档还定义了针对密钥泄露或削弱的算法提供长期保护的方法。

contents.text: The present document builds on existing standards that are widely adopted. These include:
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件以广泛采用的现有标准为基础。这些措施包括：

contents.text: - RFC 3852 [4]: "Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS)";
contents.zh-CHS: - RFC 3852[4]：“加密消息语法（CMS）”；

contents.text: - ISO/IEC 9594-8/ITU-T Recommendation X.509 [1]: "Information technology - Open Systems Interconnection - The Directory: Authentication framework";
contents.zh-CHS: - ISO/IEC 9594-8/ITU-T建议X.509[1]：“信息技术-开放系统互连-目录：认证框架”；

contents.text: - RFC 3280 [2]: "Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure (PKIX) Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile";
contents.zh-CHS: - RFC 3280[2]：“Internet X.509公钥基础设施（PKIX）证书和证书吊销列表（CRL）配置文件”；

contents.text: - RFC 3161 [7]: "Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Time-Stamp Protocol (TSP)".
contents.zh-CHS: - RFC 3161[7]：“Internet X.509公钥基础结构时间戳协议（TSP）”。

contents.text: NOTE: See Section 11 for a full set of references.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：完整的参考资料见第11节。

contents.text: The present document describes formats for advanced electronic signatures using ASN.1 (Abstract Syntax Notation 1) [14]. ASN.1 is encoded using X.690 [16].
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件描述了使用ASN.1（抽象语法符号1）[14]的高级电子签名格式。ASN.1使用X.690[16]进行编码。

contents.text: These formats are based on CMS (Cryptographic Message Syntax) defined in RFC 3852 [4]. These electronic signatures are thus called CAdES, for "CMS Advanced Electronic Signatures".
contents.zh-CHS: 这些格式基于RFC 3852[4]中定义的CMS（加密消息语法）。这些电子签名因此被称为CADE，用于“CMS高级电子签名”。

contents.text: Another document, TS 101 903 [TS101903], describes formats for XML advanced electronic signatures (XAdES) built on XMLDSIG as specified in [XMLDSIG].
contents.zh-CHS: 另一个文档TS 101 903[TS101903]描述了在[XMLDSIG]中指定的XMLDSIG上构建的XML高级电子签名（XADE）的格式。

contents.text: In addition, the present document identifies other documents that define formats for Public Key Certificates, Attribute Certificates, and Certificate Revocation Lists and supporting protocols, including protocols for use by trusted third parties to support the operation of electronic signature creation and validation.
contents.zh-CHS: 此外，本文件还确定了定义公钥证书、属性证书、证书撤销列表和支持协议格式的其他文件，包括受信任的第三方用于支持电子签名创建和验证操作的协议。

contents.text: Informative annexes include:
contents.zh-CHS: 资料性附件包括：

contents.text: - illustrations of extended forms of Electronic Signature formats that protect against various vulnerabilities and examples of validation processes (Annex B);
contents.zh-CHS: - 防止各种漏洞的电子签名格式扩展形式的说明和验证过程的示例（附件B）；

contents.text: - descriptions and explanations of some of the concepts used in the present document, giving a rationale for normative parts of the present document (Annex C);
contents.zh-CHS: - 对本文件中使用的一些概念进行说明和解释，为本文件的规范性部分提供理由（附件C）；

contents.text: - information on protocols to interoperate with Trusted Service Providers (Annex D);
contents.zh-CHS: - 关于与受信任的服务提供商进行互操作的协议的信息（附件D）；

contents.text: - guidance on naming (Annex E);
contents.zh-CHS: - 命名指南（附件E）；

contents.text: - an example structured content and MIME (Annex F);
contents.zh-CHS: - 结构化内容和MIME示例（附录F）；

contents.text: - the relationship between the present document and the directive on electronic signature and associated standardization initiatives (Annex G);
contents.zh-CHS: - 本文件与《电子签名指令》和相关标准化举措之间的关系（附件G）；

contents.text: - APIs to support the generation and verification of electronic signatures (Annex H);
contents.zh-CHS: - 支持生成和验证电子签名的API（附件H）；

contents.text: - cryptographic algorithms that may be used (Annex I); and
contents.zh-CHS: - 可使用的加密算法（附件一）；和

contents.text: - naming schemes (see Annex J).
contents.zh-CHS: - 命名方案（见附件J）。

contents.text: 3. Definitions and Abbreviations
contents.zh-CHS: 3. 定义和缩写

contents.text: 3.1. Definitions
For the purposes of the present document, the following terms and definitions apply:
contents.zh-CHS: 就本文件而言，以下术语和定义适用：

contents.text: Arbitrator: an arbitrator entity may be used to arbitrate a dispute between a signer and verifier when there is a disagreement on the validity of a digital signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 仲裁员：当对数字签名的有效性存在分歧时，仲裁员实体可用于仲裁签名人和验证者之间的争议。

contents.text: Attribute Authority (AA): an authority that assigns privileges by issuing attribute certificates.
contents.zh-CHS: 属性权限（AA）：通过颁发属性证书来分配权限的权限。

contents.text: Authority Certificate: a certificate issued to an authority (e.g., either to a certification authority or an attribute authority).
contents.zh-CHS: 颁发机构证书：颁发给颁发机构（例如，颁发给证书颁发机构或属性颁发机构）的证书。

contents.text: Attribute Authority Revocation List (AARL): a revocation list containing a list of references to certificates issued to AAs that are no longer considered valid by the issuing authority.
contents.zh-CHS: 属性颁发机构撤销列表（AARL）：一个撤销列表，包含对颁发机构不再认为有效的颁发给AAs的证书的引用列表。

contents.text: Attribute Certificate Revocation List (ACRL): a revocation list containing a list of references to attribute certificates that are no longer considered valid by the issuing authority.
contents.zh-CHS: 属性证书吊销列表（ACRL）：一个吊销列表，包含对颁发机构不再认为有效的属性证书的引用列表。

contents.text: Certification Authority Revocation List (CARL): a revocation list containing a list of public key certificates issued to certification authorities that are no longer considered valid by the certificate issuer.
contents.zh-CHS: 证书颁发机构吊销列表（CARL）：一个吊销列表，包含颁发给证书颁发机构的公钥证书列表，证书颁发机构不再认为这些证书有效。

contents.text: Certification Authority (CA): an authority trusted by one or more users to create and assign public key certificates; optionally, the certification authority may create the users' keys.
contents.zh-CHS: 证书颁发机构（CA）：一个或多个用户信任的机构，用于创建和分配公钥证书；或者，证书颁发机构可以创建用户密钥。

contents.text: NOTE: See ITU-T Recommendation X.509 [1].
contents.zh-CHS: 注：见ITU-T建议X.509[1]。

contents.text: Certificate Revocation List (CRL): a signed list indicating a set of public key certificates that are no longer considered valid by the certificate issuer.
contents.zh-CHS: 证书吊销列表（CRL）：一个签名列表，指示证书颁发者不再认为有效的一组公钥证书。

contents.text: Digital Signature: data appended to, or a cryptographic transformation of, a data unit that allows a recipient of the data unit to prove the source and integrity of the data unit and protect against forgery, e.g., by the recipient.
contents.zh-CHS: 数字签名：附加到数据单元的数据或数据单元的加密转换，允许数据单元的接收者证明数据单元的来源和完整性，并防止伪造（例如由接收者伪造）。

contents.text: NOTE: See ISO 7498-2 [ISO7498-2].
Electronic Signature: data in electronic form that is attached to or logically associated with other electronic data and that serves as a method of authentication.
contents.zh-CHS: 电子签名：附加在其他电子数据上或在逻辑上与其他电子数据关联的电子形式的数据，用作认证方法。

contents.text: NOTE: See Directive 1999/93/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 13 December 1999 on a Community framework for electronic signatures [EUDirective].
contents.zh-CHS: 注：见欧洲议会和理事会1999年12月13日关于共同体电子签名框架的指令1999/93/EC[欧盟指令]。

contents.text: Extended Electronic Signatures: electronic signatures enhanced by complementing the baseline requirements with additional data, such as time-stamp tokens and certificate revocation data, to address commonly recognized threats.
contents.zh-CHS: 扩展电子签名：通过使用附加数据（如时间戳令牌和证书撤销数据）补充基线要求，增强电子签名，以应对常见的威胁。

contents.text: Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signature (EPES): an electronic signature where the signature policy that shall be used to validate it is explicitly specified.
contents.zh-CHS: 基于明确策略的电子签名（EPES）：一种电子签名，其中明确规定了用于验证该签名的签名策略。

contents.text: Grace Period: a time period that permits the certificate revocation information to propagate through the revocation process to relying parties.
contents.zh-CHS: 宽限期：允许证书撤销信息通过撤销过程传播给依赖方的时间段。

contents.text: Initial Verification: a process performed by a verifier done after an electronic signature is generated in order to capture additional information that could make it valid for long-term verification.
contents.zh-CHS: 初始验证：在生成电子签名后，由验证者执行的一个过程，目的是获取额外信息，使其对长期验证有效。

contents.text: Public Key Certificate (PKC): public keys of a user, together with some other information, rendered unforgeable by encipherment with the private key of the certification authority that issued it.
contents.zh-CHS: 公钥证书（PKC）：用户的公钥以及其他一些信息，通过使用颁发它的证书颁发机构的私钥进行加密而变得不可伪造。

contents.text: NOTE: See ITU-T Recommendation X.509 [1].
contents.zh-CHS: 注：见ITU-T建议X.509[1]。

contents.text: Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA): an asymmetric cryptography algorithm based on the difficulty to factor very large numbers using a key pair: a private key and a public key.
contents.zh-CHS: Rivest-Shamir-Adleman（RSA）：一种非对称密码算法，基于使用密钥对（私钥和公钥）很难计算出非常大的数字。

contents.text: Signature Policy: a set of rules for the creation and validation of an electronic signature that defines the technical and procedural requirements for electronic signature creation and validation, in order to meet a particular business need, and under which the signature can be determined to be valid.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名政策：一套电子签名的创建和验证规则，定义了电子签名创建和验证的技术和程序要求，以满足特定的业务需要，并根据这些规则可以确定签名是否有效。

contents.text: Signature Policy Issuer: an entity that defines and issues a signature policy.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名策略颁发者：定义和颁发签名策略的实体。

contents.text: Signature Validation Policy: part of the signature policy that specifies the technical requirements on the signer in creating a signature and verifier when validating a signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名验证策略：签名策略的一部分，指定签名人在验证签名时创建签名和验证人的技术要求。

contents.text: Signer: an entity that creates an electronic signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名人：创建电子签名的实体。

contents.text: Subsequent Verification: a process performed by a verifier to assess the signature validity.
contents.zh-CHS: 后续验证：由验证者执行的评估签名有效性的过程。

contents.text: NOTE: Subsequent verification may be done even years after the electronic signature was produced by the signer and completed by the initial verification, and it might not need to capture more data than those captured at the time of initial verification.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：即使在签名人制作电子签名并在初始验证时完成之后几年，也可以进行后续验证，并且可能不需要捕获比初始验证时捕获的数据更多的数据。

contents.text: Time-Stamp Token: a data object that binds a representation of a datum to a particular time, thus establishing evidence that the datum existed before that time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间戳标记：一种数据对象，它将一个数据的表示绑定到一个特定的时间，从而确定该数据在该时间之前存在的证据。

contents.text: Time-Mark: information in an audit trail from a Trusted Service Provider that binds a representation of a datum to a particular time, thus establishing evidence that the datum existed before that time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间标记：来自可信服务提供商的审计跟踪中的信息，该信息将数据的表示绑定到特定时间，从而确定数据在该时间之前存在的证据。

contents.text: Time-Marking Authority: a trusted third party that creates records in an audit trail in order to indicate that a datum existed before a particular point in time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间标记机构：可信的第三方，在审计跟踪中创建记录，以表明数据在特定时间点之前存在。

contents.text: Time-Stamping Authority (TSA): a trusted third party that creates time-stamp tokens in order to indicate that a datum existed at a particular point in time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间戳授权机构（TSA）：一个可信的第三方，它创建时间戳令牌，以表明数据存在于特定时间点。

contents.text: Time-Stamping Unit (TSU): a set of hardware and software that is managed as a unit and has a single time-stamp token signing key active at a time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间戳单元（TSU）：一组硬件和软件，作为一个单元进行管理，一次只有一个时间戳令牌签名密钥处于活动状态。

contents.text: Trusted Service Provider (TSP): an entity that helps to build trust relationships by making available or providing some information upon request.
contents.zh-CHS: 可信服务提供商（TSP）：一个实体，通过在请求时提供或提供一些信息来帮助建立信任关系。

contents.text: Validation Data: additional data that may be used by a verifier of electronic signatures to determine that the signature is valid.
contents.zh-CHS: 验证数据：电子签名验证人可用于确定签名有效性的附加数据。

contents.text: Valid Electronic Signature: an electronic signature that passes validation.
contents.zh-CHS: 有效电子签名：通过验证的电子签名。

contents.text: Verifier: an entity that verifies evidence.
contents.zh-CHS: 验证人：验证证据的实体。

contents.text: NOTE 1: See ISO/IEC 13888-1 [ISO13888-1].
NOTE 2: Within the context of the present document, this is an entity that validates an electronic signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 注2：在本文件范围内，这是一个验证电子签名的实体。

For the purposes of the present document, the following abbreviations apply:
contents.zh-CHS: 在本文件中，以下缩写词适用：

contents.text: 4. Overview
contents.zh-CHS: 4. 概述

contents.text: The present document defines a number of Electronic Signature (ES) formats that build on CMS (RFC 3852 [4]) by adding signed and unsigned attributes.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件通过添加签名和未签名属性，定义了许多基于CMS（RFC 3852[4]）的电子签名格式。

contents.text: This section:
contents.zh-CHS: 本节：

contents.text: - provides an introduction to the major parties involved (Section 4.1),
contents.zh-CHS: - 介绍主要参与方（第4.1节），

contents.text: - introduces the concept of signature policies (Section 4.2),
contents.zh-CHS: - 介绍签名策略的概念（第4.2节），

contents.text: - provides an overview of the various ES formats (Section 4.3),
contents.zh-CHS: - 概述各种ES格式（第4.3节），

contents.text: - introduces the concept of validation data, and provides an overview of formats that incorporate validation data (Section 4.4), and
contents.zh-CHS: - 介绍验证数据的概念，并概述包含验证数据的格式（第4.4节），以及

contents.text: - presents relevant considerations on arbitration (Section 4.5) and for the validation process (Section 4.6).
contents.zh-CHS: - 介绍了仲裁（第4.5节）和验证过程（第4.6节）的相关注意事项。

contents.text: The formal specifications of the attributes are specified in Sections 5 and 6; Annexes C and D provide rationale for the definitions of the different ES forms.
contents.zh-CHS: 第5节和第6节规定了属性的正式规范；附录C和D提供了不同ES表格定义的基本原理。

contents.text: 4.1. Major Parties
contents.zh-CHS: 4.1. 主要政党

contents.text: The major parties involved in a business transaction supported by electronic signatures, as defined in the present document, are:
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件的定义，涉及电子签名支持的商业交易的主要当事方包括：

contents.text: - the signer; - the verifier; - Trusted Service Providers (TSP); and - the arbitrator.
contents.zh-CHS: - 签署人；-验证者；-可信服务提供商（TSP）；和-仲裁员。

contents.text: The signer is the entity that creates the electronic signature. When the signer digitally signs over data using the prescribed format, this represents a commitment on behalf of the signing entity to the data being signed.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名人是创建电子签名的实体。当签名者使用规定的格式对数据进行数字签名时，这表示代表签名实体对被签名数据的承诺。

contents.text: The verifier is the entity that validates the electronic signature; it may be a single entity or multiple entities.
contents.zh-CHS: 验证人是验证电子签名的实体；它可以是单个实体或多个实体。

contents.text: The Trusted Service Providers (TSPs) are one or more entities that help to build trust relationships between the signer and verifier. They support the signer and verifier by means of supporting services including: user certificates, cross-certificates, time-stamp tokens, CRLs, ARLs, and OCSP responses. The following TSPs are used to support the functions defined in the present document:
contents.zh-CHS: 可信服务提供者（TSP）是一个或多个实体，有助于在签名者和验证者之间建立信任关系。它们通过支持服务（包括：用户证书、交叉证书、时间戳令牌、CRL、ARL和OCSP响应）来支持签名者和验证者。以下TSP用于支持本文件中定义的功能：

contents.text: - Certification Authorities; - Registration Authorities; - CRL Issuers; - OCSP Responders; - Repository Authorities (e.g., a Directory); - Time-Stamping Authorities; - Time-Marking Authorities; and - Signature Policy Issuers.
contents.zh-CHS: - 核证机关；及登记机关；-CRL发行人；-OCSP应答器；-存储库权限（例如目录）；-加盖时间戳当局；及时间标记机构；和-签名保单发行人。

contents.text: Certification Authorities provide users with public key certificates and a revocation service.
contents.zh-CHS: 证书颁发机构为用户提供公钥证书和吊销服务。

contents.text: Registration Authorities allow the identification and registration of entities before a CA generates certificates.
contents.zh-CHS: 注册机构允许在CA生成证书之前识别和注册实体。

contents.text: Repository Authorities publish CRLs issued by CAs, signature policies issued by Signature Policy Issuers, and optionally public key certificates.
contents.zh-CHS: 存储库管理机构发布CAs发布的CRL、签名策略发布者发布的签名策略，以及可选的公钥证书。

contents.text: Time-Stamping Authorities attest that some data was formed before a given trusted time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间戳权威机构证明，某些数据是在给定的可信时间之前形成的。

contents.text: Time-Marking Authorities record that some data was formed before a given trusted time.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间标记机构记录某些数据是在给定的可信时间之前形成的。

contents.text: Signature Policy Issuers define the signature policies to be used by signers and verifiers.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名策略颁发者定义签名者和验证者要使用的签名策略。

contents.text: In some cases, the following additional TSPs are needed:
contents.zh-CHS: 在某些情况下，需要以下附加TSP：

contents.text: - Attribute Authorities.
contents.zh-CHS: - 属性权限。

contents.text: Attributes Authorities provide users with attributes linked to public key certificates.
contents.zh-CHS: 属性授权为用户提供链接到公钥证书的属性。

contents.text: An Arbitrator is an entity that arbitrates in disputes between a signer and a verifier.
contents.zh-CHS: 仲裁员是在签名人和验证人之间的争议中进行仲裁的实体。

contents.text: 4.2. Signature Policies
contents.zh-CHS: 4.2. 签名策略

contents.text: The present document includes the concept of signature policies that can be used to establish technical consistency when validating electronic signatures.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件包括签名政策的概念，可用于在验证电子签名时建立技术一致性。

contents.text: When a comprehensive signature policy used by the verifier is either explicitly indicated by the signer or implied by the data being signed, then a consistent result can be obtained when validating an electronic signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 当验证者使用的综合签名策略由签名者明确指示或由被签名的数据暗示时，则在验证电子签名时可以获得一致的结果。

contents.text: When the signature policy being used by the verifier is neither indicated by the signer nor can be derived from other data, or the signature policy is incomplete, then verifiers, including arbitrators, may obtain different results when validating an electronic signature. Therefore, comprehensive signature policies that ensure consistency of signature validation are recommended from both the signer's and verifier's point of view.
contents.zh-CHS: 当验证者正在使用的签名策略既不是由签名者指示的，也不能从其他数据派生，或者签名策略不完整时，验证者，包括仲裁员，在验证电子签名时可能会获得不同的结果。因此，从签名者和验证者的角度出发，建议采用全面的签名策略来确保签名验证的一致性。

contents.text: Further information on signature policies is provided in:
contents.zh-CHS: 有关签名政策的更多信息，请参见：

contents.text: - TR 102 038 [TR102038]; - Sections 5.8.1, C.1, and C.3.1 of the present document; - RFC 3125 [RFC3125]; and - TR 102 272 [TR102272].
4.3. Electronic Signature Formats
contents.zh-CHS: 4.3. 电子签名格式

contents.text: The current section provides an overview for two forms of CMS advanced electronic signature specified in the present document, namely, the CAdES Basic Electronic Signature (CAdES-BES) and the CAdES Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signature (CAdES-EPES). Conformance to the present document mandates that the signer create one of these formats.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节概述了本文件中规定的两种CMS高级电子签名形式，即CAdES基本电子签名（CAdES BES）和CAdES基于明确政策的电子签名（CAdES EPES）。与本文件的一致性要求签名人创建其中一种格式。

contents.text: 4.3.1. CAdES Basic Electronic Signature (CAdES-BES)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.3.1. CAdES基本电子签名（CAdES BES）

contents.text: A CAdES Basic Electronic Signature (CAdES-BES), in accordance with the present document, contains:
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，CAdES基本电子签名（CAdES BES）包含：

contents.text: - The signed user data (e.g., the signer's document), as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]);
contents.zh-CHS: - CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义的已签名用户数据（例如，签名人文件）；

contents.text: - A collection of mandatory signed attributes, as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]) and in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]);
contents.zh-CHS: - CMS（RFC 3852[4]）和ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中定义的强制性签名属性集合；

contents.text: - Additional mandatory signed attributes, defined in the present document; and
contents.zh-CHS: - 本文件中定义的其他强制性签名属性；和

contents.text: - The digital signature value computed on the user data and, when present, on the signed attributes, as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: - 根据CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中的定义，对用户数据和签名属性（如果存在）计算的数字签名值。

contents.text: A CAdES Basic Electronic Signature (CAdES-BES), in accordance with the present document, may contain:
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，CAdES基本电子签名（CAdES BES）可包含：

contents.text: - a collection of additional signed attributes; and
contents.zh-CHS: - 附加签名属性的集合；和

contents.text: - a collection of optional unsigned attributes.
contents.zh-CHS: - 可选无符号属性的集合。

contents.text: The mandatory signed attributes are:
contents.zh-CHS: 强制签名属性包括：

contents.text: - Content-type. It is defined in RFC 3852 [4] and specifies the type of the EncapsulatedContentInfo value being signed. Details are provided in Section 5.7.1 of the present document. Rationale for its inclusion is provided in Annex C.3.7;
contents.zh-CHS: - 内容类型。它在RFC 3852[4]中定义，并指定要签名的封装ContentInfo值的类型。本文件第5.7.1节提供了详细信息。附录C.3.7中提供了其包含的理由；

contents.text: - Message-digest. It is defined in RFC 3852 [4] and specifies the message digest of the eContent OCTET STRING within encapContentInfo being signed. Details are provided in Section 5.7.2;
contents.zh-CHS: - 消息摘要。它在RFC 3852[4]中定义，并指定要签名的encapContentInfo中eContent八位字节字符串的消息摘要。详情见第5.7.2节；

contents.text: - ESS signing-certificate OR ESS signing-certificate-v2. The ESS signing-certificate attribute is defined in Enhanced Security Services (ESS), RFC 2634 [5], and only allows for the use of SHA-1 as a digest algorithm. The ESS signing-certificate-v2 attribute is defined in "ESS Update: Adding CertID Algorithm Agility", RFC 5035 [15], and allows for the use of any digest algorithm. A CAdES-BES claiming compliance with the present document must include one of them. Section 5.7.3 provides the details of these attributes. Rationale for its inclusion is provided in Annex C.3.3.
contents.zh-CHS: - ESS签名证书或ESS签名证书-v2。ESS签名证书属性在增强安全服务（ESS）RFC 2634[5]中定义，仅允许将SHA-1用作摘要算法。ESS signing-certificate-v2属性在“ESS更新：添加CertID算法敏捷性”RFC 5035[15]中定义，并允许使用任何摘要算法。声称符合本文件要求的CAdES BES必须包括其中之一。第5.7.3节提供了这些属性的详细信息。附录C.3.3中提供了其包含的理由。

contents.text: Optional signed attributes may be added to the CAdES-BES, including optional signed attributes defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]), ESS (RFC 2634 [5]), and the present document. Listed below are optional attributes that are defined in Section 5 and have a rationale provided in Annex C:
contents.zh-CHS: 可选签名属性可以添加到CAdES BES中，包括CMS（RFC 3852[4]）、ESS（RFC 2634[5]）和本文档中定义的可选签名属性。以下列出了第5节中定义的可选属性，其基本原理见附录C：

contents.text: - Signing-time: as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]), indicates the time of the signature, as claimed by the signer. Details and short rationale are provided in Section 5.9.1. Annex C.3.6 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 签名时间：如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中的定义，表示签名人声明的签名时间。第5.9.1节提供了详细信息和简要理由。附录C.3.6提供了基本原理。

contents.text: - content-hints: as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]), provides information that describes the innermost signed content of a multi-layer message where one content is encapsulated in another. Section 5.10.1 provides the specification details. Annex C.3.8 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 内容提示：根据ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中的定义，提供了描述多层消息最内层签名内容的信息，其中一个内容封装在另一个内容中。第5.10.1节提供了规范细节。附录C.3.8提供了基本原理。

contents.text: - content-reference: as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]), can be incorporated as a way to link request and reply messages in an exchange between two parties. Section 5.10.1 provides the specification details. Annex C.3.9 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 内容参考：如ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中所定义，可以作为一种在双方交换中链接请求和回复消息的方式合并。第5.10.1节提供了规范细节。附录C.3.9提供了基本原理。

contents.text: - content-identifier: as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]), contains an identifier that may be used later on in the previous content-reference attribute. Section 5.10.2 provides the specification details.
contents.zh-CHS: - 内容标识符：如ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中所定义，包含一个标识符，该标识符可稍后在先前的内容引用属性中使用。第5.10.2节提供了规范细节。

contents.text: - commitment-type-indication: this attribute is defined by the present document as a way to indicate the commitment endorsed by the signer when producing the signature. Section 5.11.1 provides the specification details. Annex C.3.2 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 承诺类型指示：本文件将此属性定义为在生成签名时指示签名人背书的承诺的一种方式。第5.11.1节提供了规范细节。附录C.3.2提供了基本原理。

contents.text: - signer-location: this attribute is defined by the present document. It allows the signer to indicate the place where the signer purportedly produced the signature. Section 5.11.2 provides the specification details. Annex C.3.5 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 签名者位置：此属性由当前文档定义。它允许签名人指明签名人据称制作签名的地点。第5.11.2节提供了规范细节。附录C.3.5提供了基本原理。

contents.text: - signer-attributes: this attribute is defined by the present document. It allows a claimed or certified role to be incorporated into the signed information. Section 5.11.3 provides the specification details. Annex C.3.4 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 签名者属性：此属性由当前文档定义。它允许将声明或认证的角色合并到签名信息中。第5.11.3节提供了规范细节。附录C.3.4提供了基本原理。

contents.text: - content-time-stamp: this attribute is defined by the present document. It allows a time-stamp token of the data to be signed to be incorporated into the signed information. It provides proof of the existence of the data before the signature was created. Section 5.11.4 provides the specification details. Annex C.3.6 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - 内容时间戳：此属性由当前文档定义。它允许将要签名的数据的时间戳令牌合并到签名信息中。它提供了在创建签名之前存在数据的证据。第5.11.4节提供了规范细节。附录C.3.6提供了基本原理。

contents.text: A CAdES-BES form can also incorporate instances of unsigned attributes, as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]) and ESS (RFC 2634 [5]).
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES BES表单还可以包含CMS（RFC 3852[4]）和ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中定义的未签名属性实例。

contents.text: - CounterSignature, as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]); it can be incorporated wherever embedded signatures (i.e., a signature on a previous signature) are needed. Section 5.9.2 provides the specification details. Annex C.5 in Annex C provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: - CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义的会签；它可以在需要嵌入签名（即先前签名上的签名）的任何地方合并。第5.9.2节提供了规范细节。附录C中的附录C.5提供了基本原理。

contents.text: The structure of the CAdES-BES is illustrated in Figure 1.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES BES的结构如图1所示。

contents.text: Figure 1: Illustration of a CAdES-BES
contents.zh-CHS: 图1：CAdES BES的图解

contents.text: The signer's conformance requirements of a CAdES-BES are defined in Section 8.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 第8.1节规定了CAdES BES的签署人合规性要求。

contents.text: NOTE: The CAdES-BES is the minimum format for an electronic signature to be generated by the signer. On its own, it does not provide enough information for it to be verified in the longer term. For example, revocation information issued by the relevant certificate status information issuer needs to be available for long-term validation (see Section 4.4.2).
contents.zh-CHS: 注：CAdES BES是签名人生成电子签名的最低格式。就其本身而言，它没有提供足够的信息，以便在长期内进行核实。例如，相关证书状态信息颁发者发布的撤销信息需要可用于长期验证（见第4.4.2节）。

contents.text: The CAdES-BES satisfies the legal requirements for electronic signatures, as defined in the European Directive on Electronic Signatures, (see Annex C for further discussion on the relationship of the present document to the Directive). It provides basic authentication and integrity protection.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES BES满足《欧洲电子签名指令》中规定的电子签名的法律要求（关于本文件与该指令关系的进一步讨论，见附录C）。它提供基本的身份验证和完整性保护。

contents.text: The semantics of the signed data of a CAdES-BES or its context may implicitly indicate a signature policy to the verifier.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES BES或其上下文的签名数据的语义可以向验证者隐式地指示签名策略。

contents.text: Specification of the contents of signature policies is outside the scope of the present document. However, further information on signature policies is provided in TR 102 038 [TR102038], RFC 3125 [RFC3125], and Sections 5.8.1, C.1, and C.3.1 of the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名政策内容的具体说明不在本文件的范围之内。但是，本文件TR 102 038[TR102038]、RFC 3125[RFC3125]和第5.8.1、C.1和C.3.1节提供了有关签名政策的更多信息。

contents.text: 4.3.2. CAdES Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signatures (CAdES-EPES)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.3.2. CAdES基于明确策略的电子签名（CAdES EPES）

contents.text: A CAdES Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signature (CAdES-EPES), in accordance with the present document, extends the definition of an electronic signature to conform to the identified signature policy.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，CAdES基于明确政策的电子签名（CAdES EPES）扩展了电子签名的定义，以符合已识别的签名政策。

contents.text: A CAdES Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signature (CAdES-EPES) incorporates a signed attribute (sigPolicyID attribute) indicating the signature policy that shall be used to validate the electronic signature. This signed attribute is protected by the signature. The signature may also have other signed attributes required to conform to the mandated signature policy.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES显式基于策略的电子签名（CAdES EPES）包含一个签名属性（sigPolicyID属性），该属性指示用于验证电子签名的签名策略。此签名属性受签名保护。签名还可能具有符合强制签名策略所需的其他签名属性。

contents.text: Section 5.7.3 provides the details on the specification of signature-policy-identifier attribute. Annex C.1 provides a short rationale. Specification of the contents of signature policies is outside the scope of the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 第5.7.3节提供了有关签名策略标识符属性规范的详细信息。附件C.1提供了一个简短的理由。签名政策内容的具体说明不在本文件的范围之内。

contents.text: Further information on signature policies is provided in TR 102 038 [TR102038] and Sections 5.8.1, C.1, and C.3.1 of the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: TR 102 038[TR102038]和本文件第5.8.1、C.1和C.3.1节提供了有关签名政策的更多信息。

contents.text: The structure of the CAdES-EPES is illustrated in Figure 2.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES EPE的结构如图2所示。

contents.text: Figure 2: Illustration of a CAdES-EPES
contents.zh-CHS: 图2:CAdES EPES的示意图

contents.text: The signer's conformance requirements of CAdES-EPES are defined in Section 8.2.
contents.zh-CHS: 第8.2节规定了CAdES EPES的签署人合规性要求。

contents.text: 4.4. Electronic Signature Formats with Validation Data
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4. 带有验证数据的电子签名格式

contents.text: Validation of an electronic signature, in accordance with the present document, requires additional data needed to validate the electronic signature. This additional data is called validation data, and includes:
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，电子签字的验证需要验证电子签字所需的额外数据。此附加数据称为验证数据，包括：

contents.text: - Public Key Certificates (PKCs);
contents.zh-CHS: - 公钥证书；

contents.text: - revocation status information for each PKC;
contents.zh-CHS: - 每个PKC的撤销状态信息；

contents.text: - trusted time-stamps applied to the digital signature, otherwise a time-mark shall be available in an audit log.
contents.zh-CHS: - 应用于数字签名的可信时间戳，否则审计日志中应提供时间标记。

contents.text: - when appropriate, the details of a signature policy to be used to verify the electronic signature.
contents.zh-CHS: - 在适当情况下，用于验证电子签名的签名策略的详细信息。

contents.text: The validation data may be collected by the signer and/or the verifier. When the signature-policy-identifier signed attribute is present, it shall meet the requirements of the signature policy.
contents.zh-CHS: 验证数据可由签名者和/或验证者收集。当签名策略标识符signed属性存在时，应满足签名策略的要求。

contents.text: Validation data includes CA certificates as well as revocation status information in the form of Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) or certificate status information (OCSP) provided by an online service. Validation data also includes evidence that the signature was created before a particular point in time; this may be either a time-stamp token or time-mark.
contents.zh-CHS: 验证数据包括CA证书以及在线服务提供的证书吊销列表（CRL）或证书状态信息（OCSP）形式的吊销状态信息。验证数据还包括签名在特定时间点之前创建的证据；这可以是时间戳令牌或时间标记。

contents.text: The present document defines unsigned attributes able to contain validation data that can be added to CAdES-BES and CAdES-EPES, leading to electronic signature formats that include validation data. The sections below summarize these formats and their most relevant characteristics.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件定义了能够包含可添加到CAdES BES和CAdES EPES的验证数据的未签名属性，从而形成包含验证数据的电子签名格式。以下各节总结了这些格式及其最相关的特征。

contents.text: 4.4.1. Electronic Signature with Time (CAdES-T)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.1. 带时间的电子签名（CAdES-T）

contents.text: An electronic signature with time (CAdES-T), in accordance with the present document, is when there exits trusted time associated with the ES.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，有时间的电子签名（CAdES-T）是指存在与电子签名相关的可信时间。

contents.text: The trusted time may be provided by:
contents.zh-CHS: 可通过以下方式提供可信时间：

contents.text: - a time-stamp attribute as an unsigned attribute added to the ES; and
contents.zh-CHS: - 时间戳属性，作为添加到ES的无符号属性；和

contents.text: - a time-mark of the ES provided by a Trusted Service Provider.
contents.zh-CHS: - 由可信服务提供商提供的ES的时间标记。

contents.text: The time-stamp attribute contains a time-stamp token of the electronic signature value. Section 6.1.1 provides the specification details. Annex C.4.3 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: 时间戳属性包含电子签名值的时间戳标记。第6.1.1节提供了规范细节。附录C.4.3提供了基本原理。

contents.text: A time-mark provided by a Trusted Service would have a similar effect to the signature-time-stamp attribute, but in this case, no attribute is added to the ES, as it is the responsibility of the TSP to provide evidence of a time-mark when required to do so. The management of time marks is outside the scope of the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 受信任服务提供的时间标记与签名时间戳属性具有类似的效果，但在这种情况下，不会向ES添加任何属性，因为TSP有责任在需要时提供时间标记的证据。时间标记的管理不在本文件的范围之内。

contents.text: Trusted time provides the initial steps towards providing long-term validity. Electronic signatures with the time-stamp attribute or a time-marked BES/EPES, forming the CAdES-T are illustrated in Figure 3.
contents.zh-CHS: 可信时间为提供长期有效性提供了初始步骤。具有时间戳属性或带有时间标记的BES/EPES的电子签名构成CAdES-T，如图3所示。

contents.text: Figure 3: Illustration of CAdES-T formats
contents.zh-CHS: 图3:CAdES-T格式示意图

contents.text: NOTE 1: A time-stamp token is added to the CAdES-BES or CAdES-EPES as an unsigned attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 注1：时间戳标记作为未签名属性添加到CAdES BES或CAdES EPES。

contents.text: NOTE 2: Time-stamp tokens that may themselves include unsigned attributes required to validate the time-stamp token, such as the complete-certificate-references and complete-revocation-references attributes, as defined by the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 注2：时间戳令牌本身可能包括验证时间戳令牌所需的未签名属性，如本文档定义的完整证书引用和完整撤销引用属性。

contents.text: 4.4.2. ES with Complete Validation Data References (CAdES-C)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.2. 具有完整验证数据参考的ES（CAdES-C）

contents.text: Electronic Signature with Complete validation data references (CAdES-C), in accordance with the present document, adds to the CAdES-T the complete-certificate-references and complete-revocation-references attributes, as defined by the present document. The complete-certificate-references attribute contains references to all the certificates present in the certification path used for verifying the signature. The complete-revocation-references attribute contains references to the CRLs and/or OCSPs responses used for verifying the signature. Section 6.2 provides the specification details. Storing the references allows the values of the certification path and the CRLs or OCSPs responses to be stored elsewhere, reducing the size of a stored electronic signature format.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，带有完整验证数据参考的电子签名（CAdES-C）将本文件定义的完整证书参考和完整撤销参考属性添加到CAdES-T中。complete certificate references属性包含对用于验证签名的证书路径中存在的所有证书的引用。“完整吊销引用”属性包含对用于验证签名的CRL和/或OCSPs响应的引用。第6.2节提供了规范细节。存储引用允许将认证路径和CRLs或OCSPs响应的值存储在其他位置，从而减小存储的电子签名格式的大小。

contents.text: Sections C.4.1 to C.4.2 provide rationale on the usage of validation data and when it is suitable to generate the CAdES-C form. Electronic signatures, with the additional validation data forming the CAdES-C, are illustrated in Figure 4.
contents.zh-CHS: 第C.4.1至C.4.2节提供了验证数据使用的基本原理，以及何时适合生成CAdES-C表格。电子签名以及构成CAdES-C的其他验证数据如图4所示。

contents.text: Figure 4: Illustration of CAdES-C format
contents.zh-CHS: 图4:CAdES-C格式示意图

contents.text: NOTE 1: The complete certificate and revocation references are added to the CAdES-T as an unsigned attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 注1：完整的证书和撤销引用作为未签名属性添加到CAdES-T中。

contents.text: NOTE 2: As a minimum, the signer will provide the CAdES-BES or, when indicating that the signature conforms to an explicit signing policy, the CAdES-EPES.
contents.zh-CHS: 注2：作为最低要求，签名人将提供CAdES BES，或在表明签名符合明确的签名政策时，提供CAdES EPES。

contents.text: NOTE 3: To reduce the risk of repudiating signature creation, the trusted time indication needs to be as close as possible to the time the signature was created. The signer or a TSP could provide the CAdES-T; if not, the verifier should create the CAdES-T on first receipt of an electronic signature because the CAdES-T provides independent evidence of the existence of the signature prior to the trusted time indication.
contents.zh-CHS: 注3：为了降低拒绝签名创建的风险，可信时间指示需要尽可能接近签名创建的时间。签名者或TSP可以提供学员；如果没有，验证者应在第一次收到电子签名时创建CAdES-T，因为CAdES-T在可信时间指示之前提供了签名存在的独立证据。

contents.text: NOTE 4: A CAdES-T trusted time indication must be created before a certificate has been revoked or expired.
contents.zh-CHS: 注4：在证书被吊销或过期之前，必须创建CAdES-T可信时间指示。

contents.text: NOTE 5: The signer and TSP could provide the CAdES-C to minimize this risk, and when the signer does not provide the CAdES-C, the verifier should create the CAdES-C when the required component of revocation and validation data become available; this may require a grace period.
contents.zh-CHS: 注5：签字人和TSP可提供CAdES-C以将此风险降至最低，当签字人未提供CAdES-C时，验证人应在撤销和验证数据的所需组件可用时创建CAdES-C；这可能需要一段宽限期。

contents.text: NOTE 6: A grace period permits certificate revocation information to propagate through the revocation processes. This period could extend from the time an authorized entity requests certificate revocation to when the information is available for the relying party to use. In order to make sure that the certificate was not revoked at the time the signature was time-marked or time-stamped, verifiers should wait until the end of the grace period. A signature policy may define specific values for grace periods.
contents.zh-CHS: 注6：宽限期允许证书撤销信息通过撤销过程传播。这一期限可以从授权实体请求撤销证书的时间延长到依赖方可以使用信息的时间。为了确保在签名带有时间标记或时间戳时证书未被撤销，验证者应等到宽限期结束。签名策略可以定义宽限期的特定值。

contents.text: An illustration of a grace period is provided in Figure 5.
contents.zh-CHS: 图5提供了宽限期的说明。

contents.text:
+<--------------Grace Period --------->+
----+-------+-------+--------+---------------------+----------+
    ^       ^       ^        ^                     ^          ^
    |       |       |        |                     |          |
    |       |       |        |                     |          |
Signature   |     First      |                   Second       |
 creation   |   revocation   |                  revocation    |
  time      |     status     |                    status      |
            |    checking    |                  checking      |
            |                |                                |
        Time-stamp      Certification                       Build
           or              path                            CAdES-C
        time-mark      construction
          over          & verification
        signature
Figure 5: Illustration of a grace period
contents.zh-CHS: 图5：宽限期示意图

contents.text: NOTE 7: CWA 14171 [CWA14171] specifies a signature validation process using CAdES-T, CAdES-C, and a grace period. Annex B provides example validation processes. Annex C.4 provides additional information about applying grace periods during the validation process.
contents.zh-CHS: 注7:CWA 14171[CWA14171]规定了使用CAdES-T、CAdES-C和宽限期的签名验证过程。附录B提供了验证过程的示例。附录C.4提供了验证过程中应用宽限期的附加信息。

contents.text: The verifier's conformance requirements are defined in Section 8.3 for time-stamped CAdES-C, and Section 8.4 for time-marked CAdES-C. The present document only defines conformance requirements for the verifier up to an ES with Complete validation data (CAdES-C). This means that none of the extended and archive forms of electronic signatures, as defined in Sections 4.4.3 to 4.4.4, need to be implemented to achieve conformance to the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 第8.3节为带时间戳的CAdES-C定义了验证者的一致性要求，第8.4节为带时间戳的CAdES-C定义了验证者的一致性要求。本文件仅为具有完整验证数据（CAdES-C）的ES定义了验证者的一致性要求。这意味着无需实施第4.4.3节至第4.4.4节中定义的电子签名扩展和归档形式，以实现与本文件的一致性。

contents.text: 4.4.3. Extended Electronic Signature Formats
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.3. 扩展电子签名格式

contents.text: CAdES-C can be extended by adding unsigned attributes to the electronic signature. The present document defines various unsigned attributes that are applicable for very long-term verification, and
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES-C可以通过向电子签名添加未签名属性来扩展。本文档定义了适用于长期验证的各种未签名属性，以及

contents.text: for preventing some disaster situations that are discussed in Annex C. Annex B provides the details of the various extended formats, all the required unsigned attributes for each type, and how they can be used within the electronic signature validation process. The sections below give an overview of the various forms of extended signature formats in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了防止附件C中讨论的某些灾难情况，附件B提供了各种扩展格式的详细信息、每种类型所需的所有未签名属性，以及如何在电子签名验证过程中使用这些属性。以下各节概述了本文件中各种形式的扩展签名格式。

contents.text: 4.4.3.1. EXtended Long Electronic Signature (CAdES-X Long)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.3.1. 扩展长电子签名（CAdES-X长）

contents.text: Extended Long format (CAdES-X Long), in accordance with the present document, adds the certificate-values and revocation-values attributes to the CAdES-C format. The first one contains the whole certificate path required for verifying the signature; the second one contains the CRLs and/OCSP responses required for the validation of the signature. This provides a known repository of certificate and revocation information required to validate a CAdES-C and prevents such information from getting lost. Sections 6.3.3 and 6.3.4 give specification details. Annex B.1.1 gives details on the production of the format. Annexes C4.1 to C.4.2 provide the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，扩展长格式（CAdES-X Long）将证书值和撤销值属性添加到CAdES-C格式中。第一个包含验证签名所需的整个证书路径；第二个包含验证签名所需的CRL和/OCSP响应。这提供了验证CAdES-C所需的证书和吊销信息的已知存储库，并防止此类信息丢失。第6.3.3节和第6.3.4节给出了规范细节。附录B.1.1给出了格式制作的详细信息。附录C4.1至C.4.2提供了基本原理。

contents.text: Figure 6: Illustration of CAdES-X-Long
contents.zh-CHS: 图6:CAdES-X-Long示意图

contents.text: 4.4.3.2. EXtended Electronic Signature with Time Type 1 (CAdES-X Type 1)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.3.2. 时间类型1的扩展电子签名（CAdES-X类型1）

contents.text: Extended format with time type 1 (CAdES-X Type 1), in accordance with the present document, adds the CAdES-C-time-stamp attribute, whose content is a time-stamp token on the CAdES-C itself, to the CAdES-C format.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，时间类型为1的扩展格式（CAdES-X类型1）将CAdES-C-time-stamp属性添加到CAdES-C格式中，该属性的内容是CAdES-C本身的时间戳标记。

contents.text: This provides an integrity and trusted time protection over all the elements and references. It may protect the certificates, CRLs, and OCSP responses in case of a later compromise of a CA key, CRL key, or OCSP issuer key. Section 6.3.5 provides the specification details.
contents.zh-CHS: 这为所有元素和引用提供了完整性和受信任的时间保护。如果CA密钥、CRL密钥或OCSP颁发者密钥稍后出现泄露，它可以保护证书、CRL和OCSP响应。第6.3.5节提供了规范细节。

contents.text: Annex B.1.2 gives details on the production of the time-stamping process. Annex C.4.4.1 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: 附录B.1.2给出了时间戳过程的制作细节。附录C.4.4.1提供了基本原理。

contents.text: The structure of the CAdES-X Type 1 format is illustrated in Figure 7.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES-X Type 1格式的结构如图7所示。

contents.text: Figure 7: Illustration of CAdES-X Type 1
contents.zh-CHS: 图7:CAdES-X类型1的图解

contents.text: 4.4.3.3. EXtended Electronic Signature with Time Type 2 (CAdES-X Type 2)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.3.3. 时间类型2的扩展电子签名（CAdES-X类型2）

contents.text: Extended format with time type 2 (CAdES-X Type 2), in accordance with the present document, adds to the CAdES-C format the CAdES-C-time-stamped-certs-crls-references attribute, whose content is a time-stamp token on the certification path and revocation information references. This provides an integrity and trusted time protection over all the references.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，时间类型为2的扩展格式（CAdES-X类型2）在CAdES-C格式中添加了CAdES-C-time-stamped-certs-crls-references属性，其内容是认证路径和撤销信息引用上的时间戳令牌。这为所有引用提供了完整性和受信任的时间保护。

contents.text: It may protect the certificates, CRLs and OCSP responses in case of a later compromise of a CA key, CRL key or OCSP issuer key.
contents.zh-CHS: 它可以保护证书、CRL和OCSP响应，以防以后CA密钥、CRL密钥或OCSP颁发者密钥出现泄露。

contents.text: Both CAdES-X Type 1 and CAdES-X Type 2 counter the same threats, and the usage of one or the other depends on the environment. Section 6.3.5 provides the specification details. Annex B.1.3 gives details on the production of the time-stamping process. Annex C.4.4.2 provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES-X类型1和CAdES-X类型2都能应对相同的威胁，其中一种或另一种的使用取决于环境。第6.3.5节提供了规范细节。附录B.1.3给出了时间戳过程的制作细节。附录C.4.4.2提供了基本原理。

contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.3.4. 带时间的扩展长电子签名（CAdES-X长类型1或2）

contents.text: Extended Long with Time (CAdES-X Long Type 1 or 2), in accordance with the present document, is a combination of CAdES-X Long and one of the two former types (CAdES-X Type 1 and CAdES-X Type 2). Annex B.1.4 gives details on the production of the time-stamping process. Annex C.4.8 in Annex C provides the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，随时间延长（CAdES-X Long类型1或2）是CAdES-X Long和前两种类型（CAdES-X类型1和CAdES-X类型2）之一的组合。附录B.1.4给出了时间戳过程的制作细节。附录C中的附录C.4.8提供了基本原理。

contents.text: 4.4.4. Archival Electronic Signature (CAdES-A)
contents.zh-CHS: 4.4.4. 档案电子签名（CAdES-A）

contents.text: Archival Form (CAdES-A), in accordance with the present document, builds on a CAdES-X Long or a CAdES-X Long Type 1 or 2 by adding one or more archive-time-stamp attributes. This form is used for archival of long-term signatures. Successive time-stamps protect the whole material against vulnerable hashing algorithms or the breaking
contents.zh-CHS: 根据本文件，档案表格（CAdES-A）以CAdES-X Long或CAdES-X Long类型1或2为基础，添加一个或多个档案时间戳属性。此表格用于存档长期签名。连续的时间戳保护整个材质不受易受攻击的哈希算法或破坏

contents.text: of the cryptographic material or algorithms. Section 6.4 contains the specification details. Sections C.4.5 and C.4.8 provide the rationale.
contents.zh-CHS: 指加密材料或算法。第6.4节包含规范细节。第C.4.5节和第C.4.8节提供了基本原理。

contents.text: The structure of the CAdES-A form is illustrated in Figure 10.
contents.zh-CHS: CAdES-A表格的结构如图10所示。

contents.zh-CHS: 图10:CAdES-A的图解

contents.text: 4.5. Arbitration
The CAdES-C may be used for arbitration should there be a dispute between the signer and verifier, provided that:
contents.zh-CHS: 如果签名人和验证人之间存在争议，则CAdES-C可用于仲裁，前提是：

contents.text: - the arbitrator knows where to retrieve the signer's certificate (if not already present), all the cross-certificates and the required CRLs, ACRLs, or OCSP responses referenced in the CAdES-C;
contents.zh-CHS: - 仲裁员知道从何处检索签名人的证书（如果尚未存在）、所有交叉证书以及CAdES-C中引用的所需CRL、ACRL或OCSP响应；

contents.text: - when time-stamping in the CAdES-T is being used, the certificate from the TSU that has issued the time-stamp token in the CAdES-T format is still within its validity period;
contents.zh-CHS: - 使用CAdES-T时间戳时，TSU以CAdES-T格式颁发时间戳令牌的证书仍在其有效期内；

contents.text: - when time-stamping in the CAdES-T is being used, the certificate from the TSU that has issued the time-stamp token in the CAdES-T format is not revoked at the time of arbitration;
contents.zh-CHS: - 当在CAdES-T中使用时间戳时，在仲裁时不会撤销TSU签发的CAdES-T格式时间戳令牌的证书；

contents.text: - when time-marking in the CAdES-T is being used, a reliable audit trail from the Time-Marking Authority is available for examination regarding the time;
contents.zh-CHS: - 当使用CAdES-T中的时间标记时，时间标记机构提供的可靠审计线索可用于检查时间；

contents.text: - none of the private keys corresponding to the certificates used to verify the signature chain have ever been compromised;
contents.zh-CHS: - 与用于验证签名链的证书相对应的私钥从未被泄露；

contents.text: - the cryptography used at the time the CAdES-C was built has not been broken at the time the arbitration is performed; and
contents.zh-CHS: - 在建立CAdES-C时使用的加密技术在执行仲裁时未被破坏；和

contents.text: - if the signature policy can be explicitly or implicitly identified, then an arbitrator is able to determine the rules required to validate the electronic signature.
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果可以显式或隐式地识别签名策略，则仲裁员能够确定验证电子签名所需的规则。

contents.text: 4.6. Validation Process
contents.zh-CHS: 4.6. 验证过程

contents.text: The validation process validates an electronic signature; the output status of the validation process can be:
contents.zh-CHS: 验证过程验证电子签名；验证过程的输出状态可以是：

contents.text: - invalid;
contents.zh-CHS: - 无效的

contents.text: - incomplete validation; or
contents.zh-CHS: - 验证不完全；或

contents.text: - valid.
contents.zh-CHS: - 有效的

contents.text: An invalid response indicates that either the signature format is incorrect or that the digital signature value fails verification (e.g., the integrity check on the digital signature value fails, or any of the certificates on which the digital signature verification depends is known to be invalid or revoked).
contents.zh-CHS: 无效响应表示签名格式不正确或数字签名值未通过验证（例如，数字签名值的完整性检查失败，或数字签名验证所依赖的任何证书已知无效或已撤销）。

contents.text: An incomplete validation response indicates that the signature validation status is currently unknown. In the case of incomplete validation, additional information may be made available to the application or user, thus allowing them to decide what to do with the electronic signature. In the case of incomplete validation, the electronic signature may be checked again at some later time when additional information becomes available.
contents.zh-CHS: 验证响应不完整表示签名验证状态当前未知。在验证不完整的情况下，可向应用程序或用户提供补充信息，从而使他们能够决定如何处理电子签名。在验证不完整的情况下，可在以后获得其他信息时再次检查电子签名。

contents.text: NOTE: For example, an incomplete validation may be because all the required certificates are not available or the grace period is not completed.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：例如，验证不完整可能是因为所有必需的证书不可用或宽限期未完成。

contents.text: A valid response indicates that the signature has passed verification, and it complies with the signature validation policy.
contents.zh-CHS: 有效响应表示签名已通过验证，并且符合签名验证策略。

contents.text: Example validation sequences are illustrated in Annex B.
contents.zh-CHS: 附录B中说明了验证顺序示例。

contents.text: 5. Electronic Signature Attributes
contents.zh-CHS: 5. 电子签名属性

contents.text: This section builds upon the existing Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS), as defined in RFC 3852 [4], and Enhanced Security Services (ESS), as defined in RFC 2634 [5]. The overall structure of an Electronic Signature is as defined in CMS. The Electronic Signature (ES) uses attributes defined in CMS, ESS, and the present document. The present document defines ES attributes that it uses and that are not defined elsewhere.
contents.zh-CHS: 本节以RFC 3852[4]中定义的现有加密消息语法（CMS）和RFC 2634[5]中定义的增强安全服务（ESS）为基础。电子签名的总体结构如CMS中所定义。电子签名使用CMS、ESS和本文件中定义的属性。本文档定义了它使用的、其他地方未定义的ES属性。

contents.text: The mandated set of attributes and the digital signature value is defined as the minimum Electronic Signature (ES) required by the present document. A signature policy may mandate that other signed attributes be present.
contents.zh-CHS: 法定属性集和数字签名值被定义为本文件要求的最低电子签名。签名策略可以要求存在其他签名属性。

contents.text: 5.1. General Syntax
contents.zh-CHS: 5.1. 一般语法

contents.text: The general syntax of the ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的一般语法如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: NOTE: CMS defines content types for id-data, id-signedData, id-envelopedData, id-digestedData, id-encryptedData, and id-authenticatedData. Although CMS permits other documents to define other content types, the ASN.1 type defined should not be a CHOICE type. The present document does not define other content types.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：CMS定义了id数据、id签名数据、id信封数据、id摘要数据、id加密数据和id身份验证数据的内容类型。尽管CMS允许其他文档定义其他内容类型，但定义的ASN.1类型不应是选择类型。本文档未定义其他内容类型。

contents.text: 5.2. Data Content Type
contents.zh-CHS: 5.2. 数据内容类型

contents.text: The data content type of the ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的数据内容类型如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: NOTE: If the content type is id-data, it is recommended that the content be encoded using MIME, and that the MIME type is used to identify the presentation format of the data. See Annex F.1 for an example of using MIME to identify the encoding type.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：如果内容类型是id数据，建议使用MIME对内容进行编码，并使用MIME类型标识数据的表示格式。有关使用MIME识别编码类型的示例，请参见附录F.1。

contents.text: 5.3. Signed-data Content Type
contents.zh-CHS: 5.3. 签名数据内容类型

contents.text: The Signed-data content type of the ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的签名数据内容类型如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: 5.4. SignedData Type
contents.zh-CHS: 5.4. 符号数据类型

contents.text: The syntax of the SignedData of the ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES签名数据的语法如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: The fields of type SignedData are as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: SignedData类型的字段如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: The identification of a signer's certificate used to create the signature is always signed (see Section 5.7.3). The validation policy may specify requirements for the presence of certain certificates. The degenerate case, where there are no signers, is not valid in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 用于创建签名的签名人证书的标识始终经过签名（见第5.7.3节）。验证策略可能会指定某些证书的存在要求。没有签字人的退化情况在本文件中无效。

contents.text: 5.5. EncapsulatedContentInfo Type
contents.zh-CHS: 5.5. 封装的ContentInfo类型

contents.text: The syntax of the EncapsulatedContentInfo type ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: 封装的ContentInfo类型ES的语法如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: For the purpose of long-term validation, as defined by the present document, it is advisable that either the eContent is present, or the data that is signed is archived in such as way as to preserve any data encoding. It is important that the OCTET STRING used to generate the signature remains the same every time either the verifier or an arbitrator validates the signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了长期验证的目的，如本文件所定义，建议存在eContent，或者以保存任何数据编码的方式存档已签名的数据。每次验证器或仲裁器验证签名时，用于生成签名的八位字节字符串保持不变，这一点很重要。

contents.text: NOTE: The eContent is optional in CMS :
contents.zh-CHS: 注：eContent在CMS中是可选的：

contents.text: - When it is present, this allows the signed data to be encapsulated in the SignedData structure, which then contains both the signed data and the signature. However, the signed data may only be accessed by a verifier able to decode the ASN.1 encoded SignedData structure.
contents.zh-CHS: - 当它存在时，这允许将签名数据封装在SignedData结构中，然后该结构包含签名数据和签名。然而，签名数据只能由能够解码ASN.1编码的签名数据结构的验证器访问。

contents.text: - When it is missing, this allows the signed data to be sent or stored separately from the signature, and the SignedData structure only contains the signature. It is, in the case of the signature, only the data that is signed that needs to be stored and distributed in such as way as to preserve any data encoding.
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果缺少签名，则允许将签名数据与签名分开发送或存储，并且SignedData结构仅包含签名。在签名的情况下，只有已签名的数据才需要以保存任何数据编码的方式存储和分发。

contents.text: The degenerate case where there are no signers is not valid in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 没有签名人的退化情况在本文件中无效。

contents.text: 5.6. SignerInfo Type
contents.zh-CHS: 5.6. 签名信息类型

contents.text: The syntax of the SignerInfo type ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: 签名信息类型ES的语法如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: Per-signer information is represented in the type SignerInfo. In the case of multiple independent signatures (see Annex B.5), there is an instance of this field for each signer.
contents.zh-CHS: 每个签名者的信息在SignerInfo类型中表示。对于多个独立签名（见附件B.5），每个签名人都有一个该字段的实例。

contents.text: The fields of type SignerInfo have the meanings defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]), but the signedAttrs field shall contain the following attributes:
contents.zh-CHS: SignerinInfo类型的字段具有CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义的含义，但signedAttrs字段应包含以下属性：

contents.text: - content-type, as defined in Section 5.7.1; and
contents.zh-CHS: - 第5.7.1节中定义的内容类型；和

contents.text: - message-digest, as defined in Section 5.7.2;
contents.zh-CHS: - 第5.7.2节中定义的消息摘要；

contents.text: - signing-certificate, as defined in Section 5.7.3.
contents.zh-CHS: - 第5.7.3节中定义的签署证书。

contents.text: 5.6.1. Message Digest Calculation Process
contents.zh-CHS: 5.6.1. 消息摘要计算过程

contents.text: The message digest calculation process is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: 消息摘要计算过程如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: 5.6.2. Message Signature Generation Process
contents.zh-CHS: 5.6.2. 消息签名生成过程

contents.text: The input to the message signature generation process is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: 消息签名生成过程的输入如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: 5.6.3. Message Signature Verification Process
contents.zh-CHS: 5.6.3. 消息签名验证过程

contents.text: The procedures for message signature verification are defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]) and enhanced in the present document: the input to the signature verification process must be the signer's public key, which shall be verified as correct using the signing certificate reference attribute containing a reference to the signing certificate, i.e., when SigningCertificateV2 from RFC 5035 [16] or SigningCertificate from ESS [5] is used, the public key from the first certificate identified in the sequence of certificate identifiers from SigningCertificate must be the key used to verify the digital signature.
contents.zh-CHS: 消息签名验证程序在CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义并在本文件中得到增强：签名验证过程的输入必须是签名者的公钥，应使用包含签名证书引用的签名证书引用属性验证其正确性，即。，当使用来自RFC 5035[16]的SigningCertificateV2或来自ESS[5]的SigningCertificate时，来自SigningCertificate的证书标识符序列中标识的第一个证书的公钥必须是用于验证数字签名的密钥。

contents.text: 5.7. Basic ES Mandatory Present Attributes
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7. 基本呈现属性

contents.text: The following attributes shall be present with the signed-data defined by the present document. The attributes are defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: 以下属性应与本文件定义的签名数据一起呈现。这些属性在CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义。

contents.text: 5.7.1. content-type
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7.1. 内容类型

contents.text: The content-type attribute indicates the type of the signed content. The syntax of the content-type attribute type is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]) Section 11.1.
contents.zh-CHS: content type属性指示已签名内容的类型。内容类型属性类型的语法如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）第11.1节所定义。

contents.text: NOTE 1: As stated in RFC 3852 [4] , the content-type attribute must have its value (i.e., ContentType) equal to the eContentType of the EncapsulatedContentInfo value being signed.
contents.zh-CHS: 注1：如RFC 3852[4]中所述，内容类型属性的值（即ContentType）必须等于要签名的封装ContentInfo值的eContentType。

contents.text: NOTE 2: For implementations supporting signature generation, if the content-type attribute is id-data, then it is recommended that the eContent be encoded using MIME. For implementations supporting signature verification, if the signed data (i.e., eContent) is MIME-encoded, then the OID of the content-type attribute must be id-data. In both cases, the MIME content-type(s) must be used to identify the presentation format of the data. See Annex F for further details about the use of MIME.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意2：对于支持签名生成的实现，如果content-type属性是id-data，则建议使用MIME对eContent进行编码。对于支持签名验证的实现，如果签名数据（即eContent）是MIME编码的，则content type属性的OID必须是id数据。在这两种情况下，必须使用MIME内容类型来标识数据的表示格式。有关MIME使用的更多详细信息，请参见附录F。

contents.text: 5.7.2. Message Digest
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7.2. 消息摘要

contents.text: The syntax of the message-digest attribute type of the ES is as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的消息摘要属性类型的语法如CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中所定义。

contents.text: 5.7.3. Signing Certificate Reference Attributes
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7.3. 签名证书引用属性

contents.text: The Signing certificate reference attributes are supported by using either the ESS signing-certificate attribute or the ESS-signing-certificate-v2 attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 通过使用ESS Signing certificate属性或ESS-Signing-certificate-v2属性支持签名证书引用属性。

contents.text: These attributes shall contain a reference to the signer's certificate; they are designed to prevent simple substitution and reissue attacks and to allow for a restricted set of certificates to be used in verifying a signature. They have a compact form (much shorter than the full certificate) that allows for a certificate to be unambiguously identified.
contents.zh-CHS: 这些属性应包含对签名人证书的引用；它们旨在防止简单的替换和重新发布攻击，并允许在验证签名时使用一组受限的证书。它们有一个紧凑的表单（比完整的证书短得多），允许明确地标识证书。

contents.text: One, and only one, of the following alternative attributes shall be present with the signedData, defined by the present document:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下可选属性中的一个（且仅一个）应与本文件定义的签名数据一起提供：

contents.text: - The ESS signing-certificate attribute, defined in ESS [5], must be used if the SHA-1 hashing algorithm is used.
contents.zh-CHS: - 如果使用SHA-1哈希算法，则必须使用ESS[5]中定义的ESS签名证书属性。

contents.text: - The ESS signing-certificate-v2 attribute, defined in "ESS Update: Adding CertID Algorithm Agility", RFC 5035 [15], which shall be used when other hashing algorithms are to be used.
contents.zh-CHS: - ESS signing-certificate-v2属性，在“ESS更新：添加CertID算法敏捷性”RFC 5035[15]中定义，在使用其他哈希算法时应使用该属性。

contents.text: The certificate to be used to verify the signature shall be identified in the sequence (i.e., the certificate from the signer), and the sequence shall not be empty. The signature validation policy may mandate other certificates be present that may include all the certificates up to the trust anchor.
contents.zh-CHS: 用于验证签名的证书应按顺序标识（即签名人的证书），且顺序不得为空。签名验证策略可能要求存在其他证书，这些证书可能包括信任锚之前的所有证书。

contents.text: 5.7.3.1. ESS signing-certificate Attribute Definition
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7.3.1. ESS签名证书属性定义

contents.text: The syntax of the signing-certificate attribute type of the ES is as defined in Enhanced Security Services (ESS), RFC 2634 [5], and further qualified in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: ES的签名证书属性类型的语法如增强安全服务（ESS）、RFC 2634[5]中所定义，并在本文档中进一步限定。

contents.text: The sequence of the policy information field is not used in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档中未使用“策略信息”字段的顺序。

contents.text: The ESS signing-certificate attribute shall be a signed attribute. The encoding of the ESSCertID for this certificate shall include the issuerSerial field.
contents.zh-CHS: ESS签名证书属性应为已签名属性。本证书的ESSCertID编码应包括发行人序列字段。

contents.text: If present, the issuerAndSerialNumber in SignerIdentifier field of the SignerInfo shall match the issuerSerial field present in ESSCertID. In addition, the certHash from ESSCertID shall match the SHA-1 hash of the certificate. The certificate identified shall be used during the signature verification process. If the hash of the certificate does not match the certificate used to verify the signature, the signature shall be considered invalid.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果存在，则签名信息的SignerIdentifier字段中的issuerAndSerialNumber应与ESSCertID中的issuerSerial字段匹配。此外，来自ESSCertID的certHash应与证书的SHA-1哈希匹配。应在签名验证过程中使用识别的证书。如果证书的哈希与用于验证签名的证书不匹配，则签名应视为无效。

contents.text: NOTE: Where an attribute certificate is used by the signer to associate a role, or other attributes of the signer, with the electronic signature; this is placed in the signer-attributes attribute as defined in Section 5.8.3.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：签名人使用属性证书将角色或签名人的其他属性与电子签名关联；该属性位于第5.8.3节定义的“签名者属性”属性中。

contents.text: 5.7.3.2. ESS signing-certificate-v2 Attribute Definition
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7.3.2. ESS signing-certificate-v2属性定义

contents.text: The ESS signing-certificate-v2 attribute is similar to the ESS signing-certificate defined above, except that this attribute can be used with hashing algorithms other than SHA-1.
contents.zh-CHS: ESS signing-certificate-v2属性与上面定义的ESS signing-certificate类似，不同之处在于此属性可用于SHA-1以外的哈希算法。

contents.text: The syntax of the signing-certificate-v2 attribute type of the ES is as defined in "ESS Update: Adding CertID Algorithm Agility", RFC 5035 [15], and further qualified in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: ES的signing-certificate-v2属性类型的语法如“ESS更新：添加CertID算法敏捷性”RFC 5035[15]中所定义，并在本文档中进一步限定。

contents.text: The sequence of the policy information field is not used in the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文档中未使用“策略信息”字段的顺序。

contents.text: This attribute shall be used in the same manner as defined above for the ESS signing-certificate attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 该属性的使用方式应与上述ESS签名证书属性相同。

contents.text:
The object identifier for this attribute is:
      id-aa-signingCertificateV2 OBJECT IDENTIFIER ::=
      { iso(1) member-body(2) us(840) rsadsi(113549) pkcs(1) pkcs9(9)
        smime(16) id-aa(2) 47 }

If present, the issuerAndSerialNumber in SignerIdentifier field of the SignerInfo shall match the issuerSerial field present in ESSCertIDv2. In addition, the certHash from ESSCertIDv2 shall match the hash of the certificate computed using the hash function specified in the hashAlgorithm field. The certificate identified shall be used during the signature verification process. If the hash of the certificate does not match the certificate used to verify the signature, the signature shall be considered invalid.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果存在，则签名信息的SignerIdentifier字段中的issuerAndSerialNumber应与ESSCertiverD2中的issuerSerial字段匹配。此外，ESSCertIDv2中的certHash应与使用hashAlgorithm字段中指定的哈希函数计算的证书哈希相匹配。应在签名验证过程中使用识别的证书。如果证书的哈希与用于验证签名的证书不匹配，则签名应视为无效。

contents.text: NOTE 1: Where an attribute certificate is used by the signer to associate a role, or other attributes of the signer, with the electronic signature; this is placed in the signer-attributes attribute as defined in Section 5.8.3.
contents.zh-CHS: 注1：签名人使用属性证书将角色或签名人的其他属性与电子签名相关联；该属性位于第5.8.3节定义的“签名者属性”属性中。

contents.text: NOTE 2: RFC 3126 was using the other signing-certificate attribute (see Section 5.7.3.3) for the same purpose. Its use is now deprecated, since this structure is simpler.
contents.zh-CHS: 注2:RFC 3126出于相同目的使用了其他签名证书属性（见第5.7.3.3节）。由于这种结构更简单，现在不推荐使用它。

contents.text: 5.7.3.3. Other signing-certificate Attribute Definition
contents.zh-CHS: 5.7.3.3. 其他签名证书属性定义

contents.text: RFC 3126 was using the other signing-certificate attribute as an alternative to the ESS signing-certificate when hashing algorithms other than SHA-1 were being used. Its use is now deprecated, since the structure of the signing-certificate-v2 attribute is simpler. Its description is however still present in this version for backwards compatibility.
contents.zh-CHS: 当使用SHA-1以外的散列算法时，RFC 3126使用other signing certificate属性作为ESS签名证书的替代方案。现在不推荐使用它，因为signing-certificate-v2属性的结构更简单。但是，为了向后兼容，它的描述仍然存在于该版本中。

contents.text: The other-signing-certificate attribute value has the ASN.1 syntax OtherSigningCertificate:
contents.zh-CHS: “其他签名证书”属性值具有ASN.1语法OtherSigningCertificate:

contents.text: OtherHashValue ::= OCTET STRING
5.8. Additional Mandatory Attributes for Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signatures
contents.zh-CHS: 5.8. 显式基于策略的电子签名的附加强制属性

contents.text: 5.8.1. signature-policy-identifier
contents.zh-CHS: 5.8.1. 签名策略标识符

contents.text: The present document mandates that for CAdES-EPES, a reference to the signature policy is included in the signedData. This reference is explicitly identified. A signature policy defines the rules for creation and validation of an electronic signature, and is included as a signed attribute with every Explicit Policy-based Electronic Signature. The signature-policy-identifier shall be a signed attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定，对于CAdES EPES，签名数据中应包含对签名政策的参考。此引用已明确标识。签名策略定义了创建和验证电子签名的规则，并作为签名属性包含在每个显式基于策略的电子签名中。签名策略标识符应为签名属性。

contents.text: The following object identifier identifies the signature-policy-identifier attribute:
contents.zh-CHS: 以下对象标识符标识签名策略标识符属性：

contents.text: signature-policy-identifier attribute values have ASN.1 type SignaturePolicyIdentifier:
contents.zh-CHS: 签名策略标识符属性值具有ASN.1类型的SignaturePolicyIdentifier:

contents.text: SignaturePolicyImplied ::= NULL
The sigPolicyId field contains an object-identifier that uniquely identifies a specific version of the signature policy. The syntax of this field is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: sigPolicyId字段包含唯一标识签名策略特定版本的对象标识符。此字段的语法如下所示：

contents.text: SigPolicyId ::= OBJECT IDENTIFIER

The sigPolicyHash field optionally contains the identifier of the hash algorithm and the hash of the value of the signature policy. The hashValue within the sigPolicyHash may be set to zero to indicate that the policy hash value is not known.
contents.zh-CHS: sigPolicyHash字段可选地包含哈希算法的标识符和签名策略值的哈希。sigPolicyHash中的hashValue可以设置为零，以指示策略哈希值未知。

contents.text: NOTE: The use of a zero sigPolicyHash value is to ensure backwards compatibility with earlier versions of the current document. If sigPolicyHash is zero, then the hash value should not be checked against the calculated hash value of the signature policy.
contents.zh-CHS: 注意：使用零sigPolicyHash值是为了确保与当前文档的早期版本向后兼容。如果sigPolicyHash为零，则不应根据签名策略的计算哈希值检查哈希值。

contents.text: If the signature policy is defined using ASN.1, then the hash is calculated on the value without the outer type and length fields, and the hashing algorithm shall be as specified in the field sigPolicyHash.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果签名策略是使用ASN.1定义的，则散列是在没有外部类型和长度字段的值上计算的，散列算法应符合字段sigPolicyHash中的规定。

contents.text: If the signature policy is defined using another structure, the type of structure and the hashing algorithm shall be either specified as part of the signature policy, or indicated using a signature policy qualifier.
contents.zh-CHS: 如果使用其他结构定义了签名策略，则应将结构类型和哈希算法指定为签名策略的一部分，或使用签名策略限定符指示。

contents.text: SigPolicyHash ::= OtherHashAlgAndValue
OtherHashValue ::= OCTET STRING

A Signature Policy Identifier may be qualified with other information about the qualifier. The semantics and syntax of the qualifier is as associated with the object-identifier in the sigPolicyQualifierId field. The general syntax of this qualifier is as follows:
contents.zh-CHS: 签名策略标识符可以与有关限定符的其他信息一起限定。限定符的语义和语法与sigPolicyQualifierId字段中的对象标识符相关联。此限定符的一般语法如下所示：

contents.text: The present document specifies the following qualifiers:
contents.zh-CHS: 本文件规定了以下限定符：

contents.text: - spuri: this contains the web URI or URL reference to the signature policy, and
contents.zh-CHS: - spuri：它包含对签名策略的web URI或URL引用，以及

contents.text: - sp-user-notice: this contains a user notice that should be displayed whenever the signature is validated.
contents.zh-CHS: - sp user NOTIONE（sp用户通知）：它包含一个用户通知，在验证签名时应显示该用户通知。

contents.text:
sigpolicyQualifierIds defined in the present document:
SigPolicyQualifierId ::= OBJECT IDENTIFIER
SPuri ::= IA5String
NoticeReference ::= SEQUENCE {
organization DisplayText, noticeNumbers SEQUENCE OF INTEGER }
contents.zh-CHS: 组织显示文本，通知整数的枚举序列}

contents.text: 5.9. CMS Imported Optional Attributes
contents.zh-CHS: 5.9. CMS导入了可选属性

contents.text: The following attributes may be present with the signed-data; the attributes are defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]) and are imported into the present document. Where appropriate, the attributes are qualified and profiled by the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名数据可能具有以下属性：；这些属性在CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义，并导入到本文档中。在适当情况下，本文件对这些属性进行了限定和分析。

contents.text: 5.9.1. signing-time
contents.zh-CHS: 5.9.1. 签署时间

contents.text: The signing-time attribute specifies the time at which the signer claims to have performed the signing process.
contents.zh-CHS: 签名时间属性指定签名者声称已执行签名过程的时间。

contents.text: Signing-time attribute values for ES have the ASN.1 type SigningTime as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的签名时间属性值具有CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义的ASN.1类型的签名时间。

contents.text: NOTE: RFC 3852 [4] states that dates between January 1, 1950 and December 31, 2049 (inclusive) must be encoded as UTCTime. Any dates with year values before 1950 or after 2049 must be encoded as GeneralizedTime.
contents.zh-CHS: 注：RFC 3852[4]规定1950年1月1日至2049年12月31日（含）之间的日期必须编码为UTCTime。年份值在1950年之前或2049年之后的任何日期都必须编码为GeneratedTime。

contents.text: 5.9.2. countersignature
The countersignature attribute values for ES have ASN.1 type CounterSignature, as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]). A countersignature attribute shall be an unsigned attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: ES的会签属性值具有CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义的ASN.1类型会签。会签属性应为未签名属性。

contents.text: 5.10. ESS-Imported Optional Attributes
contents.zh-CHS: 5.10. ESS导入了可选属性

contents.text: The following attributes may be present with the signed-data defined by the present document. The attributes are defined in ESS and are imported into the present document and are appropriately qualified and profiled by the present document.
contents.zh-CHS: 以下属性可能与本文档定义的签名数据一起出现。这些属性在ESS中定义，并导入到本文档中，并由本文档进行适当的限定和分析。

contents.text: 5.10.1. content-reference Attribute
contents.zh-CHS: 5.10.1. 内容引用属性

contents.text: The content-reference attribute is a link from one SignedData to another. It may be used to link a reply to the original message to which it refers, or to incorporate by reference one SignedData into another. The content-reference attribute shall be a signed attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 内容引用属性是从一个SignedData到另一个SignedData的链接。它可以用于将回复链接到它所引用的原始消息，或者通过引用将一个签名数据合并到另一个签名数据中。内容引用属性应为签名属性。

contents.text: content-reference attribute values for ES have ASN.1 type ContentReference, as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的内容引用属性值具有ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中定义的ASN.1类型的ContentReference。

contents.text: The content-reference attribute shall be used as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]).
contents.zh-CHS: 内容参考属性应按照ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中的定义使用。

contents.text: 5.10.2. content-identifier Attribute
contents.zh-CHS: 5.10.2. 内容标识符属性

contents.text: The content-identifier attribute provides an identifier for the signed content, for use when a reference may be later required to that content; for example, in the content-reference attribute in other signed data sent later. The content-identifier shall be a signed attribute.
contents.zh-CHS: 内容标识符属性为签名内容提供标识符，以便在稍后可能需要对该内容进行引用时使用；例如，在以后发送的其他签名数据的“内容引用”属性中。内容标识符应为签名属性。

contents.text: content-identifier attribute type values for the ES have an ASN.1 type ContentIdentifier, as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的内容标识符属性类型值具有ASN.1类型的内容标识符，如ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中所定义。

contents.text: The minimal content-identifier attribute should contain a concatenation of user-specific identification information (such as a
contents.zh-CHS: 最小内容标识符属性应包含特定于用户的标识信息（例如

contents.text: user name or public keying material identification information), a GeneralizedTime string, and a random number.
contents.zh-CHS: 用户名或公钥材料标识信息）、泛化时间字符串和随机数。

contents.text: 5.10.3. content-hints Attribute
contents.zh-CHS: 5.10.3. 内容提示属性

contents.text: The content-hints attribute provides information on the innermost signed content of a multi-layer message where one content is encapsulated in another.
contents.zh-CHS: “内容提示”属性提供有关多层消息的最内层签名内容的信息，其中一个内容封装在另一个内容中。

contents.text: The syntax of the content-hints attribute type of the ES is as defined in ESS (RFC 2634 [5]).
contents.zh-CHS: ES的内容提示属性类型的语法如ESS（RFC 2634[5]）中所定义。

contents.text: When used to indicate the precise format of the data to be presented to the user, the following rules apply:
contents.zh-CHS: 当用于指示要呈现给用户的数据的精确格式时，以下规则适用：

contents.text: - the contentType indicates the type of the associated content. It is an object identifier (i.e., a unique string of integers) assigned by an authority that defines the content type; and
contents.zh-CHS: - contentType指示关联内容的类型。它是由定义内容类型的机构分配的对象标识符（即，唯一的整数字符串）；和

contents.text: - when the contentType is id-data, the contentDescription shall define the presentation format; the format may be defined by MIME types.
contents.zh-CHS: - 当contentType为id数据时，contentDescription应定义表示格式；格式可以由MIME类型定义。

contents.text: When the format of the content is defined by MIME types, the following rules apply:
contents.zh-CHS: 当内容的格式由MIME类型定义时，以下规则适用：

contents.text: - the contentType shall be id-data, as defined in CMS (RFC 3852 [4]);
contents.zh-CHS: - 内容类型应为CMS（RFC 3852[4]）中定义的id数据；

contents.text: - the contentDescription shall be used to indicate the encoding of the data, in accordance with the rules defined RFC 2045 [6]; see Annex F for an example of structured contents and MIME.
